intro: Clematis viticella var. rubra-grandiflora, commonly known as the red giant clematis, is a vigorous climbing vine native to Europe. It features large, showy flowers that range from red to pink, often with a contrasting white throat, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets, and its stems are covered in fine, rusty-colored hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires a sturdy support structure for its rapid growth. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and hardiness in temperate climates.
